sections.procedure:
1.  The case originated in an application (no. 62526/15) against the Russian Federation lodged with the Court under Article 34 of the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms (“the Convention”) by a Russian national, Ms Leyla Khamarzovna Muruzheva (“the applicant”), on 11 December 2015.
2.  The applicant was represented by Ms V. Kogan and Mr E. Wesselink from the Stichting Russian Justice Initiative, an NGO based in Moscow. The Russian Government (“the Government”) were initially represented by Mr G. Matyushkin, Representative of the Russian Federation to the European Court of Human Rights, and then by his successor in that office, Mr M. Galperin.
3.  The applicant complained about the authorities’ failure to enforce the judgment of 25 June 2014 granting her a residence order in respect of her children.
4.  On 25 April 2016 the application was communicated to the Government.
sections.circumstances:
5.  The applicant was born in 1985 and lives in Moscow.
6.  In May 2008 she married R.M. The couple settled in Moscow.
7.  On 23 July 2008 and 31 May 2012 the applicant gave birth to two children, a son and a daughter respectively.
8.  In January 2014 she and R.M. decided to separate.
9.  On 14 January 2014 R.M. took the children to the Republic of Ingushetiya without the applicant knowing. He left them with his parents (the paternal grandparents) and went back to Moscow.
10.  On 4 March 2014 the marriage between the applicant and R.M. was dissolved.
11.  On 11 March 2014 the applicant applied to the Izmaylovskiy District Court of Moscow (“the District Court”) for a residence order in respect of the children. She also applied for child maintenance from R.M.
12.  On 25 June 2014 the District Court decided that the children should reside with their mother, the applicant. It further ordered R.M. to return the children to her and pay child maintenance. The judgment became final on 14 October 2014.
13.  However, R.M. refused to comply with the judgment.
14.  On 10 November 2014 the District Court issued a writ of execution.
15.  On 17 November 2014 the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service in the Republic of Ingushetiya refused to institute enforcement proceedings since the debtor, R.M., resided in Moscow.
16.  On 24 November 2014 the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service in Moscow opened enforcement proceedings.
17.  On 2 February 2015 the enforcement proceedings were transferred to the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service in the Republic of Ingushetiya.
18.  On 12 February 2015 the applicant challenged the lawfulness of the above-mentioned decision before the District Court.
19.  On 8 April 2015 the District Court found the decision of 2 February 2015 to be unlawful.
20.  Meanwhile, on 23 March, 2 April, 14 April and 16 April 2015 a bailiff from the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service tried to enforce the judgment of 25 June 2014 without success: on 23 March and 16 April 2015 due to the emotional state of the children, on 2 April 2015 because the children were outside the territory of the Republic of Ingushetiya, and on 14 April 2015 because the applicant was absent.
21.  On 24 April 2015 the applicant challenged in court the lawfulness of the bailiffs’ actions during the attempt to return the children to her on 16 April 2015, in particular: involvement of the wrong district childcare authority in the enforcement, refusal of a request by her to have the enforcement filmed, refusal to examine an objection by her concerning a psychologist participating in the enforcement, delay in notification of the enforcement, establishment during the enforcement of the applicant’s son’s preferences as to his future living arrangements, as well as the bailiffs’ inaction resulting in the failure to secure enforcement of the judgment of 25 June 2014.
22.  On 11 June 2015 the Magasskiy District Court of the Republic of Ingushetiya found the bailiffs’ actions during the attempt to return the children to the applicant on 16 April 2015 to be unlawful.
23.  On 17 June 2015 a bailiff from the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service restricted R.M.’s travel within the Russian Federation for six months.
24.  Meanwhile, according to the Government, on 16 June, 5 July, an unspecified date in July, 15 July and 17 August 2015 a bailiff from the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service informed the applicant that the enforcement was scheduled for 22 June, 6 July, 13 July, 27 July and 19 August 2015 respectively. On each of the five occasions R.M. took the children to the premises of the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service. However, since neither the applicant nor her representative were present, the enforcement could not take place.
25.  According to the applicant, she was never informed of the enforcement dates scheduled for 22 June, 6 July, 13 July, 27 July and 19 August 2015.
26.  It appears from the case file that the notification of 16 June 2015 was sent to R.M.’s address. The notifications of 15 July and 17 August 2015 were sent to the applicant’s address, though there is no evidence to suggest that she received them. The case file contains no evidence that she was notified of the other two scheduled dates for carrying out the enforcement measures either.
27.  On 17 September 2015 the enforcement file was returned to the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service in Moscow pursuant to the decision of the District Court of 8 April 2015 (see paragraph 19 above).
28.  On 6 October and 20 October 2015 a bailiff from the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service in Moscow ordered R.M. to comply with the judgment of 25 June 2014 by 13 October and 23 October 2015 respectively. He further visited R.M. at his place of residence in Moscow. It was established that the children were living with R.M.’s parents in the Republic of Ingushetiya.
29.  On 23 October 2015 the deputy chief bailiff of the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed an administrative fine on R.M. of 2,500 Russian roubles (RUB) for failure to comply with the judgment of 25 June 2014.
30.  On 3 November 2015 a bailiff from the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service invited R.M. to the bailiffs’ office on 10 November 2015 to provide explanations for his non-compliance with the judgment of 25 June 2014.
31.  On 10 November 2015 the bailiff imposed an execution fee on R.M. of RUB 5,000 for failure to comply with the judgment of 25 June 2014. He was ordered to comply by 13 November 2015.
32.  On 20 November 2015 the deputy chief bailiff of the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed a further administrative fine on R.M. of RUB 2,500 for failure to comply with the judgment of 25 June 2014.
33.  On the same day the chief bailiff of the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed an administrative fine on R.M. of RUB 1,000 for failure to comply with the lawful demands of the bailiffs.
34.  On 14 January 2016 the Commission for the Affairs of Minors and the Protection of Their Rights of the Severnoye Izmaylovo District in Moscow imposed an administrative fine on R.M. of RUB 2,000.
35.  On the same day the bailiff temporarily restricted R.M.’s travel in view of his failure to comply with the judgment of 25 June 2014, and ordered him to pay the imposed administrative fines. R.M. was invited to the bailiffs’ office on 19 January 2016 to provide explanations for his reluctance to comply with the judgment of 25 June 2014, and was ordered to comply by 20 January 2016.
36.  At the applicant’s request, on 3 February 2016 the bailiff launched a search for the children and restricted R.M.’s right to drive.
37.  On 5 February 2016 the chief bailiff of the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed an administrative fine on R.M. of RUB 1,000 for failure to comply with the lawful demands of the bailiffs.
38.  On 13 April 2016 the bailiff telephoned R.M. and asked him to attend the bailiffs’ office to provide explanations for his non-compliance with the judgment of 25 June 2014. He refused to do so.
39.  On 14 April 2016 the bailiff suspended the enforcement proceedings.
40.  According to the Government, on 5 May 2016 the bailiff informed the applicant that the enforcement was scheduled for 10 a.m. on 19 May 2016 at the children’s place of residence in the Republic of Ingushetiya. However, since she failed to attend, the enforcement could not be carried out.
41.  According to the applicant, she was not informed of the enforcement scheduled for 19 May 2016.
42.  It appears from the case file that the notification of 5 May 2016 was sent to R.M.’s address.
43.  The judgment of 25 June 2014 remains unenforced to date. The children continue to live with their paternal grandparents in the Republic of Ingushetiya.
II.  RELEVANT DOMESTIC LAW
44.  For the relevant provisions of domestic law, see Pakhomova v. Russia (no. 22935/11, §§ 91-112, 24 October 2013).

events.source_text: The Court unanimously Declares the application admissible; Holds that there has been a violation of Article 8 of the Convention; Holds (a) that the respondent State is to pay the applicant, within three months from the date on which the judgment becomes final in accordance with Article 44 § 2 of the Convention, the following amounts, to be converted into the currency of the respondent State at the rate applicable at the date of settlement: (i) EUR 12,500 (twelve thousand five hundred euros), plus any tax that may be chargeable, in respect of non-pecuniary damage; (ii) EUR 3,000 (three thousand euros), plus any tax that may be chargeable to the applicant, in respect of costs and expenses, to be paid to the bank account of the Stichting Russian Justice Initiative NGO; (b) that from the expiry of the above-mentioned three months until settlement simple interest shall be payable on the above amounts at a rate equal to the marginal lending rate of the European Central Bank during the default period plus three percentage points;
events.event: The Court unanimously Declares the application admissible; Holds that there has been a violation of Article 8 of the Convention; Holds (a) that the respondent State is to pay the applicant, within three months from the date on which the judgment becomes final in accordance with Article 44 § 2 of the Convention, the following amounts, to be converted into the currency of the respondent State at the rate applicable at the date of settlement: (i) EUR 12,500 (twelve thousand five hundred euros), plus any tax that may be chargeable, in respect of non-pecuniary damage; (ii) EUR 3,000 (three thousand euros), plus any tax that may be chargeable to the applicant, in respect of costs and expenses, to be paid to the bank account of the Stichting Russian Justice Initiative NGO; (b) that from the expiry of the above-mentioned three months until settlement simple interest shall be payable on the above amounts at a rate equal to the marginal lending rate of the European Central Bank during the default period plus three percentage points;

events.source_text: On 25 April 2016 the application was communicated to the Government.
events.event: The application was communicated to the Government on 25 April 2016.

events.source_text: The applicant was born in 1985 and lives in Moscow.
events.event: The applicant was born in 1985 and resides in Moscow.

events.source_text: In May 2008 she married R.M. The couple settled in Moscow.
events.event: The applicant married R.M. and they settled in Moscow in May 2008.

events.source_text: On 23 July 2008 and 31 May 2012 the applicant gave birth to two children, a son and a daughter respectively.
events.event: The applicant gave birth to a son on 23 July 2008 and a daughter on 31 May 2012.

events.source_text: In January 2014 she and R.M. decided to separate.
events.event: The applicant and R.M. decided to separate in January 2014.

events.source_text: On 14 January 2014 R.M. took the children to the Republic of Ingushetiya without the applicant knowing.
events.event: On 14 January 2014, R.M. took the children to the Republic of Ingushetiya without the applicant's knowledge.

events.source_text: On 4 March 2014 the marriage between the applicant and R.M. was dissolved.
events.event: The marriage between the applicant and R.M. was dissolved on 4 March 2014.

events.source_text: On 11 March 2014 the applicant applied to the Izmaylovskiy District Court of Moscow ("the District Court") for a residence order in respect of the children.
events.event: The applicant applied to the Izmaylovskiy District Court of Moscow for a residence order regarding her children on 11 March 2014.

events.source_text: She also applied for child maintenance from R.M.
events.event: The applicant also requested child maintenance from R.M.

events.source_text: On 25 June 2014 the District Court decided that the children should reside with their mother, the applicant. It further ordered R.M. to return the children to her and pay child maintenance.
events.event: The District Court decided on 25 June 2014 that the children should live with the applicant and ordered R.M. to return them and pay child maintenance.

events.source_text: The judgment became final on 14 October 2014.
events.event: The judgment became final on 14 October 2014.

events.source_text: However, R.M. refused to comply with the judgment.
events.event: R.M. failed to comply with the judgment.

events.source_text: On 10 November 2014 the District Court issued a writ of execution.
events.event: The District Court issued a writ of execution on 10 November 2014.

events.source_text: On 17 November 2014 the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service in the Republic of Ingushetiya refused to institute enforcement proceedings since the debtor, R.M., resided in Moscow.
events.event: The Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service in the Republic of Ingushetiya declined to initiate enforcement proceedings as R.M. resided in Moscow on 17 November 2014.

events.source_text: On 24 November 2014 the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service in Moscow opened enforcement proceedings.
events.event: The Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service in Moscow initiated enforcement proceedings on 24 November 2014.

events.source_text: On 2 February 2015 the enforcement proceedings were transferred to the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service in the Republic of Ingushetiya.
events.event: The enforcement proceedings were transferred to the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service in the Republic of Ingushetiya on 2 February 2015.

events.source_text: On 12 February 2015 the applicant challenged the lawfulness of the above-mentioned decision before the District Court.
events.event: The applicant contested the legality of the aforementioned decision before the District Court on 12 February 2015.

events.source_text: On 8 April 2015 the District Court found the decision of 2 February 2015 to be unlawful.
events.event: The District Court declared the decision of 2 February 2015 to be unlawful on 8 April 2015.

events.source_text: Meanwhile, on 23 March, 2 April, 14 April and 16 April 2015 a bailiff from the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service tried to enforce the judgment of 25 June 2014 without success:
events.event: Between 23 March and 16 April 2015, a bailiff from the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service attempted to enforce the judgment of 25 June 2014 unsuccessfully.
events.event_who: a bailiff from the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service

events.source_text: On 23 March and 16 April 2015 due to the emotional state of the children, on 2 April 2015 because the children were outside the territory of the Republic of Ingushetiya, and on 14 April 2015 because the applicant was absent.
events.event: The reasons for the unsuccessful enforcement attempts on 23 March, 2 April, 14 April and 16 April 2015 were: emotional state of the children, children being outside the Republic of Ingushetiya's territory, and applicant's absence.

events.source_text: On 24 April 2015 the applicant challenged in court the lawfulness of the bailiffs’ actions during the attempt to return the children to her on 16 April 2015, in particular:
events.event: The applicant filed a complaint in court regarding the legality of the bailiffs' actions during the enforcement attempt on 16 April 2015, specifically:

events.source_text: involvement of the wrong district childcare authority in the enforcement, refusal of a request by her to have the enforcement filmed, refusal to examine an objection by her concerning a psychologist participating in the enforcement, delay in notification of the enforcement, establishment during the enforcement of the applicant’s son’s preferences as to his future living arrangements, as well as the bailiffs’ inaction resulting in the failure to secure enforcement of the judgment of 25 June 2014.
events.event: The issues raised by the applicant in her complaint on 24 April 2015 were: involvement of the incorrect district childcare authority, refusal to allow filming of the enforcement, refusal to consider her objection regarding a psychologist participating in the enforcement, delay in notification of the enforcement, determination of her son's preferences during the enforcement, and bailiffs' failure to enforce the judgment of 25 June 2014.

events.source_text: On 11 June 2015 the Magasskiy District Court of the Republic of Ingushetiya found the bailiffs’ actions during the attempt to return the children to the applicant on 16 April 2015 to be unlawful.
events.event: The Magasskiy District Court of the Republic of Ingushetiya ruled that the bailiffs' actions during the enforcement attempt on 16 April 2015 were unlawful on 11 June 2015.

events.source_text: On 17 June 2015 a bailiff from the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service restricted R.M.’s travel within the Russian Federation for six months.
events.event: A bailiff from the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed a travel restriction on R.M. for six months on 17 June 2015.
events.event_who: a bailiff from the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service

events.source_text: Meanwhile, according to the Government, on 16 June, 5 July, an unspecified date in July, 15 July and 17 August 2015 a bailiff from the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service informed the applicant that the enforcement was scheduled for 22 June, 6 July, 13 July, 27 July and 19 August 2015 respectively.
events.event: According to the Government, a bailiff from the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service informed the applicant about scheduled enforcement dates on various occasions between June and August 2015.
events.event_who: a bailiff from the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service

events.source_text: On each of the five occasions R.M. took the children to the premises of the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service.
events.event: On each of the five occasions, R.M. brought the children to the Sunzhenskiy District Bailiffs’ Service.

events.source_text: However, since neither the applicant nor her representative were present, the enforcement could not take place.
events.event: Since the applicant or her representative was not present, the enforcement could not occur.

events.source_text: According to the applicant, she was never informed of the enforcement dates scheduled for 22 June, 6 July, 13 July, 27 July and 19 August 2015.
events.event: The applicant claims that she was not informed about the scheduled enforcement dates on 22 June, 6 July, 13 July, 27 July and 19 August 2015.

events.source_text: It appears from the case file that the notification of 16 June 2015 was sent to R.M.’s address.
events.event: The case file indicates that the notification of 16 June 2015 was delivered to R.M.'s address.

events.source_text: The notifications of 15 July and 17 August 2015 were sent to the applicant’s address, though there is no evidence to suggest that she received them.
events.event: Notifications on 15 July and 17 August 2015 were sent to the applicant's address, but there is no evidence suggesting that she received them.

events.source_text: The case file contains no evidence that she was notified of the other two scheduled dates for carrying out the enforcement measures either.
events.event: The case file does not contain any evidence regarding her notification for the remaining two enforcement dates.

events.source_text: On 17 September 2015 the enforcement file was returned to the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service in Moscow pursuant to the decision of the District Court of 8 April 2015 (see paragraph 19 above).
events.event: The enforcement file was returned to the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service in Moscow on 17 September 2015 as per the District Court's decision of 8 April 2015 (refer to paragraph 19 above).

events.source_text: On 6 October and 20 October 2015 a bailiff from the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service in Moscow ordered R.M. to comply with the judgment of 25 June 2014 by 13 October and 23 October 2015 respectively.
events.event: A bailiff from the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service in Moscow demanded that R.M. adhere to the judgment of 25 June 2014 on 6 October and 20 October 2015 respectively.
events.event_who: a bailiff from the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service

events.source_text: He further visited R.M. at his place of residence in Moscow.
events.event: The bailiff also paid a visit to R.M.'s residence in Moscow.

events.source_text: It was established that the children were living with R.M.’s parents in the Republic of Ingushetiya.
events.event: It was determined that the children resided with R.M.'s parents in the Republic of Ingushetiya.

events.source_text: On 23 October 2015 the deputy chief bailiff of the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed an administrative fine on R.M. of 2,500 Russian roubles (RUB) for failure to comply with the judgment of 25 June 2014.
events.event: The deputy chief bailiff of the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed an administrative fine of 2,500 RUB on R.M. for non-compliance with the judgment of 25 June 2014 on 23 October 2015.

events.source_text: On the same day the chief bailiff of the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed an administrative fine on R.M. of RUB 1,000 for failure to comply with the lawful demands of the bailiffs.
events.event: The chief bailiff of the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed a fine of 1,000 RUB on R.M. for disregarding the lawful orders of the bailiffs on the same day.

events.source_text: On 3 November 2015 a bailiff from the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service invited R.M. to the bailiffs’ office on 10 November 2015 to provide explanations for his non-compliance with the judgment of 25 June 2014.
events.event: A bailiff from the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service summoned R.M. to appear at their office on 10 November 2015 to explain his non-compliance with the judgment of 25 June 2014.
events.event_who: a bailiff from the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service

events.source_text: On 10 November 2015 the bailiff imposed an execution fee on R.M. of RUB 5,000 for failure to comply with the judgment of 25 June 2014.
events.event: The bailiff levied an execution fee of 5,000 RUB against R.M. for his non-compliance with the judgment of 25 June 2014 on 10 November 2015.

events.source_text: He was ordered to comply by 13 November 2015.
events.event: He was instructed to adhere by 13 November 2015.

events.source_text: On 20 November 2015 the deputy chief bailiff of the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed a further administrative fine on R.M. of RUB 2,500 for failure to comply with the judgment of 25 June 2014.
events.event: The deputy chief bailiff of the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed an additional administrative fine of 2,500 RUB on R.M. for his continued non-compliance with the judgment of 25 June 2014 on 20 November 2015.
events.event_what: imposed, imposed a further administrative fine

events.source_text: On the same day the chief bailiff of the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed an administrative fine on R.M. of RUB 1,000 for failure to comply with the lawful demands of the bailiffs.
events.event: The chief bailiff of the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed a fine of 1,000 RUB on R.M. for disregarding the lawful orders of the bailiffs on the same day.

events.source_text: On 14 January 2016 the Commission for the Affairs of Minors and the Protection of Their Rights of the Severnoye Izmaylovo District in Moscow imposed an administrative fine on R.M. of RUB 2,000.
events.event: The Commission for the Affairs of Minors and the Protection of Their Rights of the Severnoye Izmaylovo District in Moscow levied a fine of 2,000 RUB against R.M. on 14 January 2016.

events.source_text: On the same day the bailiff temporarily restricted R.M.’s right to drive.
events.event: The bailiff temporarily suspended R.M.'s driving privileges on the same day.

events.source_text: On 5 February 2016 the chief bailiff of the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed an administrative fine on R.M. of RUB 1,000 for failure to comply with the lawful demands of the bailiffs.
events.event: The chief bailiff of the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed a fine of 1,000 RUB on R.M. for disregarding the lawful orders of the bailiffs on 5 February 2016.

events.source_text: At the applicant’s request, on 3 February 2016 the bailiff launched a search for the children and restricted R.M.’s right to drive.
events.event: The bailiff initiated a search for the children and suspended R.M.'s driving privileges at the applicant's request on 3 February 2016.

events.source_text: On 5 February 2016 the chief bailiff of the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed an administrative fine on R.M. of RUB 1,000 for failure to comply with the lawful demands of the bailiffs.
events.event: The chief bailiff of the Izmaylovskiy District Bailiffs’ Service imposed a fine of 1,000 RUB on R.M. for disregarding the lawful orders of the bailiffs on 5 February 2016.

events.source_text: On 13 April 2016 the bailiff telephoned R.M. and asked him to attend the bailiffs’ office to provide explanations for his non-compliance with the judgment of 25 June 2014.
events.event: The bailiff contacted R.M. by phone on 13 April 2016, requesting him to appear at their office to explain his non-compliance with the judgment of 25 June 2014.

events.source_text: He refused to do so.
events.event: He declined to comply.

events.source_text: On 14 April 2016 the bailiff suspended the enforcement proceedings.
events.event: The bailiff halted the enforcement proceedings on 14 April 2016.

events.source_text: According to the Government, on 5 May 2016 the bailiff informed the applicant that the enforcement was scheduled for 10 a.m. on 19 May 2016 at the children’s place of residence in the Republic of Ingushetiya.
events.event: According to the Government, the bailiff notified the applicant about the scheduled enforcement on 19 May 2016 at the children's residence in the Republic of Ingushetiya on 5 May 2016.

events.source_text: However, since she failed to attend, the enforcement could not be carried out.
events.event: Since she did not appear, the enforcement could not occur.

events.source_text: According to the applicant, she was not informed of the enforcement scheduled for 19 May 2016.
events.event: The applicant claims that she was not informed about the scheduled enforcement on 19 May 2016.

events.source_text: It appears from the case file that the notification of 5 May 2016 was sent to R.M.’s address.
events.event: The case file indicates that the notification of 5 May 2016 was delivered to R.M.'s address.

events.source_text: The judgment of 25 June 2014 remains unenforced to date. The children continue to live with their paternal grandparents in the Republic of Ingushetiya.
events.event: The judgment of 25 June 2014 remains unenforced and the children reside with their paternal grandparents in the Republic of Ingushetiya as of present.

events.event: Relevant domestic law is provided in section II.

events.source_text: FOR THESE REASONS, THE COURT, UNANIMOUSLY,
events.event: The Court, unanimously,

events.source_text: 1.   Declares the application admissible;
events.event: Declares the application admissible.

events.source_text: 2.   Holds that there has been a violation of Article 8 of the Convention;
events.event: Holds that there has been a violation of Article 8 of the Convention.

events.source_text: 3.   Holds (a)  that the respondent State is to pay the applicant, within three months from the date on which the judgment becomes final in accordance with Article 44 §§ 2 and 3 of the Convention, the following amounts, to be converted into the currency of the respondent State at the rate applicable at the date of settlement:
events.event: Holds that the respondent State is required to compensate the applicant within three months from the final judgment's effective date in accordance with Article 44 §§ 2 and 3 of the Convention, as follows (a):
events.event_what: holds, required to compensate, within three months, following amounts:

events.source_text: (i)  EUR 12,500 (twelve thousand five hundred euros), plus any tax that may be chargeable, in respect of non-pecuniary damage;
events.event: (i)  EUR 12,500 (twelve thousand five hundred euros) plus any applicable taxes for non-pecuniary damages.

events.source_text: (ii)  EUR 3,000 (three thousand euros), plus any tax that may be chargeable to the applicant, in respect of costs and expenses, to be paid to the bank account of the Stichting Russian Justice Initiative NGO;
events.event: (ii)  EUR 3,000 (three thousand euros) plus any applicable taxes for the applicant's costs and expenses, to be transferred to the Stichting Russian Justice Initiative NGO's bank account.

events.source_text: (b)  that from the expiry of the above-mentioned three months until settlement simple interest shall be payable on the above amounts at a rate equal to the marginal lending rate of the European Central Bank during the default period plus three percentage points;
events.event: (b)  That simple interest at a rate equivalent to the European Central Bank's marginal lending rate during the default period plus three percentage points shall be payable on the above amounts from the expiration of the specified three months until settlement.

events.source_text: 4.   Dismisses the remainder of the applicant’s claim for just satisfaction.
events.event: Dismisses the remaining parts of the applicant's request for fair compensation.

events.event: Completed in English and delivered in written form on 15 May 2018, as per Rule 77 §§ 2 and 3 of the Rules of Court.
events.event_what: completed, delivered in written form, pursuant to Rule 77 §§ 2 and 3

events.source_text: On the same day the bailiff temporarily restricted R.M.’s travel in view of his failure to comply with the judgment of 25 June 2014, and ordered him to pay the imposed administrative fines. events.source_text: On 14 April 2016 the bailiff suspended the enforcement proceedings.

events.source_text: According to the Government, on 5 May 2016 the bailiff informed the applicant that the enforcement was scheduled for 10 a.m. on 19 May 2016 at the children’s place of residence in the Republic of Ingushetiya. However, since she failed to attend, the enforcement could not be carried out.

events.source_text: 1. Declares the application admissible;
events.event: 1. Declares the application admissible;

events.source_text: 2. Holds that there has been a violation of Article 8 of the Convention;
events.event: 2. Holds that there has been a violation of Article 8 of the Convention;

events.source_text: 3. Holds
events.event: 3. Holds

events.source_text: (a) that the respondent State is to pay the applicant, within three months from the date on which the judgment becomes final in accordance with Article 44 § 2 of the Convention, the following amounts, to be converted into the currency of the respondent State at the rate applicable at the date of settlement: (i) EUR 12,500 (twelve thousand five hundred euros), plus any tax that may be chargeable, in respect of non-pecuniary damage; (ii) EUR 3,000 (three thousand euros), plus any tax that may be chargeable to the applicant, in respect of costs and expenses, to be paid to the bank account of the Stichting Russian Justice Initiative NGO;

events.source_text: (b) that from the expiry of the above-mentioned three months until settlement simple interest shall be payable on the above amounts at a rate equal to the marginal lending rate of the European Central Bank during the default period plus three percentage points;
